pullRequest.body:
+ Prove `isSemisimple_of_mem_adjoin`: if two commuting endomorphisms of a finite-dimensional vector space over a perfect field are both semisimple, then every endomorphism in the algebra generated by them (in particular their product and sum) is semisimple.

+ In the same file LinearAlgebra/Semisimple.lean, `eq_zero_of_isNilpotent_isSemisimple` and `isSemisimple_of_squarefree_aeval_eq_zero` are golfed, and `IsSemisimple.minpoly_squarefree` is proved

RingTheory/SimpleModule.lean:

+ Define `IsSemisimpleRing R` to mean that R is a semisimple R-module.
add properties of simple modules and a characterization (they are exactly the quotients of the ring by maximal left ideals).

+ The annihilator of a semisimple module is a radical ideal.

+ Any module over a semisimple ring is semisimple.

+ A finite product of semisimple rings is semisimple.

+ Any quotient of a semisimple ring is semisimple.

+ Add Artin--Wedderburn as a TODO (proof_wanted).

+ Order/Atoms.lean: add the instance from `IsSimpleOrder` to `ComplementedLattice`, so that `IsSimpleModule → IsSemisimpleModule` is automatically inferred.

Prerequisites for showing a product of semisimple rings is semisimple:

+ Algebra/Module/Submodule/Map.lean: generalize `orderIsoMapComap` so that it only requires `RingHomSurjective` rather than `RingHomInvPair`

+ Algebra/Ring/CompTypeclasses.lean, Mathlib/Algebra/Ring/Pi.lean, Algebra/Ring/Prod.lean: add RingHomSurjective instances


RingTheory/Artinian.lean:

+ `quotNilradicalEquivPi`: the quotient of a commutative Artinian ring R by its nilradical is isomorphic to the (finite) product of its quotients by maximal ideals (therefore a product of fields).
`equivPi`: if the ring is moreover reduced, then the ring itself is a product of fields. Deduce that R is a semisimple ring and both R and R[X] are decomposition monoids. Requires `RingEquiv.quotientBot` in RingTheory/Ideal/QuotientOperations.lean.

+ Data/Polynomial/Eval.lean: the polynomial ring over a finite product of rings is isomorphic to the product of polynomial rings over individual rings. (Used to show R[X] is a decomposition monoid.)

Other necessary results:

+ FieldTheory/Minpoly/Field.lean: the minimal polynomial of an element in a reduced algebra over a field is radical.

+ RingTheory/PowerBasis.lean: generalize `PowerBasis.finiteDimensional` and rename it to `.finite`.

Annihilator stuff, some of which do not end up being used:

+ RingTheory/Ideal/Operations.lean: define `Module.annihilator` and redefine `Submodule.annihilator` in terms of it; add lemmas, including one that says an arbitrary intersection of radical ideals is radical. The new lemma `Ideal.isRadical_iff_pow_one_lt` depends on `pow_imp_self_of_one_lt` in Mathlib/Data/Nat/Interval.lean, which is also used to golf the proof of `isRadical_iff_pow_one_lt`.

+ Algebra/Module/Torsion.lean: add a lemma and an instance (unused)

+ Data/Polynomial/Module/Basic.lean: add a def (unused) and a lemma

+ LinearAlgebra/AnnihilatingPolynomial.lean: add lemma `span_minpoly_eq_annihilator`

Some results about idempotent linear maps (projections) and idempotent elements, used to show that any (left) ideal in a semisimple ring is spanned by an idempotent element (unused):

+ LinearAlgebra/Projection.lean: add def `isIdempotentElemEquiv`

+ LinearAlgebra/Span.lean: add two lemmas


---

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/3e7bb472-b89a-4640-9edb-7e64f98e2e2f) for commit 25de5ed519afcc4e1495fbe6433c9de57255ab3d.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.
I’m away on holiday (with patchy phone-only internet) so I can’t review this but I’m delighted to see it. Thanks!

!bench
(might help figure out what causes the simpNF typeclass timeouts)

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e13922f4-7d75-45f8-aa4f-6dc169164e6d) for commit f67c80a95a0ce07d07e017ec2d992518cf75af6e.
The entire run failed.
Found no significant differences.

#11127 is a subset of this PR on which the simpNF linter doesn't fail. I'll try to extend to larger and larger subsets and see when it fails.
Test 2: #11134 (narrowed down to four files)

Great, this passes CI now. It turns out the ArtinianRing->SemisimpleRing instance is the culprit that made the simpNF linter fail, maybe because SemisimpleRing is an abbrev of ComplementedLattice which triggers unhinged typeclass search in other parts of the library.

:v: alreadydone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

As this PR is labelled `auto-merge-after-CI`, we are now sending it to bors:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8149637126/job/22274619260)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8149637126/job/22274619380)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8149637126/job/22274619645)

Minor comment. LGTM. Thanks a lot for this substantial refactor/addition!

bors d+

Minor comment. LGTM. Thanks a lot for this substantial refactor/addition!

bors d+
suggestion : rename hsucc to hmul and hP to hpow
done, thanks!

can you add a section here, that gathers the result that only hold for a perfect field.
This will add structure to the file.
done
I feel that definition of Submodule.IsPrincipal should be moved to another (more basic) file so that this import is not necessary.
I agree! I think I missed the opportunity in #10327, but both that PR and this one are already large. Hopefully there will be another opportunity soon ...
Well, that's something that will be forgotten in two days. Maybe a simple invocation of #find_home! will indicate you the place to move this.
Probably I should also move IsPrincipalIdealRing earlier (or create a new file PrincipalIdealDomain/Defs) so I can also add the IsSemisimpleRing -> IsPrincipalIdealRing instance ...
done now
typo : IsSimpleModule
add this in the initial docstring?

There are other results worth mentioning in the module docstring, e.g. all prime ideals are maximal and there are only finitely many, the Jacobson radical is nilpotent ... Maybe use a dedicated documentation PR for all of them?
Well, I'd suggest to just do it right now for the stuff you add here, and leave to somebody else to do the rest (might be you if you wish!).
added docstring to Artinian and SimpleModule
I had understood that in Lean4, haveI doesn't need that an instance is added. Probably have is sufficient.
Yeah, the `I` in `haveI` stands for `inline` in Lean 4 rather than `instance`, but I habitually write `haveI` to signify instances, but maybe that's pointless. Removed the `I` now.
The files Ideal/Operations and Ideal/QuotientOperations are long, maybe some split will have to be considered…
or golfs ...
While you're at it, add IsSemisimpleModule.sSup and .iSup?

There's already the biSup version (from which this is deduced) and it's easy to convert iSup and sSup using [iSup_univ](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#iSup_univ) and [sSup_eq_iSup](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/CompleteLattice.html#sSup_eq_iSup), so I think we can omit the sSup and iSup versions.
OK, then…
Hmm, these shouldn't require PerfectField. Will fix.

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem colon_top {I : Ideal R} : I.colon ⊤ = I := by
```

```suggestion
@[simp]
theorem colon_bot : colon ⊥ N = N.annihilator := by
```
Applied, thanks!
